author: Staff Reporter
text:
Kanyakumari district police have started preparing a list of antisocial elements prior to the Assembly election and they have so far identified 700 people with criminal background.

Khader Basha, Deputy Superintendent of Police, District Crime Records Bureau, who is in charge of the special cell established for election-related work, told The Hindu that 91 persons had been arrested as a precautionary measure since March 4, under Sections 107, 109 and 110 of the Code of Criminal Procedure in Nagercoil, Kanyakumari and Thuckalay sub-divisions.

The list of antisocial elements/ history-sheeters had been prepared with assistance from the intelligence units.

Bonds were also being collected from antisocial elements by the respective police stations.

The arrested persons would be produced before the respective Revenue Divisional Officer/ Sub- Collector for enquiry, Mr. Basha said.

The Election Commission of India had instructed the State police to keep history-sheeters and antisocial elements out of their native towns till the polls got over.

The district police are also issuing notices to over 100 persons against whom non-bailable warrants are pending.
title: 91 under preventive custody
